subject: Re: [sugar] Smaller XO Sugar arrow cursor?
body:
Could size be dynamic?  For example, blooming to an enlarged "attention-getting" size while slewing or moving rapidly, shrinking to a "precision" size (pointer, I-beam, fist, or whatever is appropriate to hovering context)...provided that kind of behavior isn't blocked by some patently obvious patent ;-) 
cheers,--ken ritchie (atlanta)On 6/26/07, Alan Kay <alan.kay@squeakland.org> wrote:
Hi Folks --Now that we've had more experience with running things on the XO, I
feel that the default "big arrow" cursor is too big. It really getsin the way of many kinds of "pointing and hitting" operations: text,small buttons, etc.What do you think? Could we make this cursor smaller? Could we make
its shape a little more pleasing?Cheers,Alan_______________________________________________Sugar mailing listSugar@lists.laptop.org
http://lists.laptop.org/listinfo/sugar
